wikipedia_page.main: Hugh Dunbar Brown (18 May 1919 – 10 March 2008) was a British Labour Party politician. After serving as a councillor on the Glasgow Corporation, he was Member of Parliament for Glasgow Provan for 23 years. He has been described as the last "Red Clydesider".

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1983 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1966 United Kingdom general election

response: His son was Neil Carmichael, who was also a Glasgow Labour MP for several years, and was later created a life peer as Lord Carmichael of Kelvingrove. His son-in-law was Labour MP Hugh Brown.
* Hugh Brown (Queen's Park footballer), Scottish footballer who made one appearance for Queen's Park in 1915
* Hugh Brown (footballer, born 1921) (1921–1994), Scottish footballer, played for Partick Thistle, Torquay United and Scotland
* Hugh Brown (footballer, born 1940), Scottish footballer, played for Kilmarnock, Dumbarton and Scotland under-23
* Hugh Brown (politician) (1919–2008), Scottish Member of Parliament
*Hugh Brown, 88, British Labour politician, Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State for Scotland (1974–1979).
